TopicTitle: Increase anti-torque strength on the Alligator Hinge

Articles.Content:
Currently when creating a wing design as such

You end up with the wing flapping all over the place which cannot be fixed into place by any stock means.
There should be an option to secure the wings on the plane so it does not flap all over the place.

9 hours ago, spamanator500 said:

Currently when creating a wing design as such

You end up with the wing flapping all over the place which cannot be fixed into place by any stock means.
There should be an option to secure the wings on the plane so it does not flap all over the place.

Use lock.

13 hours ago, Pds314 said:

Use lock.

Well, the question is if they are supposed to be rotated during flight. If the wings are only supposed to move when on the ground or in orbit (i.e. when there is no strong mechanical force applied to the wing. Then locking them in place during flight is indeed the way to go. (This is how my folding-wing aircraft work.) But if you want to move them during flight - because variable-sweep wing look cool are more efficient for transsonic flight (at least in RL if not in game) - then locking them in place becomes problematic.
